title: Department of Computer Science
bannerCon: The University of Wyoming welcomes students to experience a one-of-a-kind education in the heart of the Mountain West.

items.subTitle: Overview
items.contents: The Department of Computer Science, established with B.Sc. Computer Science in 1995 and now it is offering a Postgraduate programme and Research Programme. The department provides a current and comprehensive learning environment for the students. The department fosters personal and professional growth for both students and faculty and is committed to impart quality education by providing strong fundamental knowledge complemented by extensive practical training. With academic autonomy, the department regularly updates its curriculum and syllabi enabling the students to apply the latest techniques, methods, and tools to solve problems in all domains.

items.subTitle: Vision
content: The Computer Science Department is formed to provide the best leading programs in the computer-oriented programme which are recognized across the world. The faculty and students dedicate themselves to take the maximal advantage of modern Computer Science to solve a wide range of complex scientific, technological and social problems. The department continues to promote innovative research in the core Computer Science as well as multidisciplinary application areas.

items.subTitle: Mission
content: To provide motivated faculty and state of the art facilities for education and research, both in foundational aspects and emerging computing trends.
To develop knowledgeable, industry-ready students with pertinent competencies such as problem solving, leadership, and interpersonal skills

content.title: Dr.S.Mythili
content.caption: Professor and Head
content.content: Computer Science Department is supported by a dedicated team of expert faculty and equipped with state-of-the-art labs and Well-structured classrooms that create an engaging learning environment. We offer a well-structured curriculum that blends theory with practical skills, supported by real-time problem-solving, industry-based projects, and extensive internship opportunities.With strong placement training, international exposure, and start-up support through KIIC, we are committed to preparing our students to excel in leading industries and to innovate with confidence.We continuously adopt innovative ICT-enabled teaching methods to ensure that students stay updated with the latest technological developments. This approach not only enhances their academic understanding but also builds their ability to adapt to the fast-evolving digital world.Our department strongly believes in holistic development. Along with academic excellence, we encourage students to participate in technical events, research activities, and professional clubs that help them build leadership qualities, communication skills, and a spirit of teamwork. We aim to produce graduates who are not only skilled professionals but also responsible contributors to society.

items.qualityPolicyText: The following patents were awarded to the faculty members of the department
list: Industry-Aligned Curriculum: Structured around current trends such as AI, Cloud Computing, Data Science, Cyber Security, and Full-Stack Development.
State-of-the-Art Laboratories: Equipped with advanced tools, software, and high-performance systems to support practical learning.
Value-Added Courses & Certifications: Students receive training in AWS, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud, Python, Power BI, TensorFlow, Ethical Hacking, and more.
Project-Based Learning: Every semester includes real-time projects, mini-projects, and innovative problem-solving tasks.
Strong Placement Support: Pre-placement training, mock interviews, aptitude coaching, and exclusive industry tie-ups ensure excellent placement outcomes.
MoUs & Collaborations: Partnerships with leading IT companies for internships, research, and skill development.
mottContnet: Hackathons, coding challenges, and tech fests every semester
Regular workshops, seminars, guest lectures, and industry expert sessions
Active department clubs: Coding Club, Cyber Security Club, AI & Data Science Forum, Creative Media Cell
Student mentoring system for academic and career guidance
Community outreach and digital literacy initiatives
